Public NotInheritable Class StringBuilder Implements ISerializable

summary.span: 表示可变字符字符串。

span.span: Represents a mutable string of characters.

summary.span: 此类不能被继承。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 此类表示其值是可变的字符序列的类似字符串的对象。This class represents a string-like object whose value is a mutable sequence of characters. 本节内容：In this section: - [字符串和 StringBuilder 类型The String and StringBuilder types](#StringAndSB) - [StringBuilder 的工作原理How StringBuilder works](#HowWorks) - [内存分配Memory allocation](#Memory) - [实例化 StringBuilder 对象Instantiating a StringBuilder object](#Instantiating) - [调用 StringBuilder 方法Calling StringBuilder methods](#Calling) - [执行 StringBuilder 操作Performing StringBuilder operations](#Operations) - [循环访问 StringBuilder 字符Iterating StringBuilder characters](#Iterating) - [将文本添加到 StringBuilder 对象Adding text to a StringBuilder object](#Adding) - [从 StringBuilder 对象中删除文本Deleting text from a StringBuilder object](#Deleting) - [修改 StringBuilder 对象中的文本Modifying the text in a StringBuilder object](#Modifying) - [StringBuilder 对象中搜索的文本Searching the text in a StringBuilder object](#Searching) - [将 StringBuilder 对象转换为字符串Converting the StringBuilder object to a string](#Converting) ## 字符串和 StringBuilder 类型The String and StringBuilder types 尽管和二者都表示序列的字符，它们的实现方式有所不同。Although and both represent sequences of characters, they are implemented differently. 是不可变类型。 is an immutable type. 也就是说，每个操作，它可修改对象实际上会创建一个新的字符串。That is, each operation that appears to modify a object actually creates a new string. 例如，在调用方法在下面的 C# 示例显示名为的字符串变量的值更改`value`。For example, the call to the method in the following C# example appears to change the value of a string variable named `value`. 事实上，方法将返回`value`对象具有不同的值和从地址`value`传递给方法的对象。In fact, the method returns a `value` object that has a different value and address from the `value` object that was passed to the method. 请注意，必须使用编译该示例`/unsafe`编译器选项。Note that the example must be compiled using the `/unsafe` compiler option. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/immutability2.cs#1)] 对于执行广泛的字符串操作 （例如修改在循环中多次的字符串的应用） 的例程，重复修改字符串可以精确对显著的性能产生负面影响。For routines that perform extensive string manipulation (such as apps that modify a string numerous times in a loop), modifying a string repeatedly can exact a significant performance penalty. 替代方法是使用，它是一个可变字符串类。The alternative is to use , which is a mutable string class. 可变性意味着，一旦创建类的实例后，它可以修改通过追加、 删除、 替换或插入字符。Mutability means that once an instance of the class has been created, it can be modified by appending, removing, replacing, or inserting characters. 一个对象维护一个缓冲区以容纳扩展到字符串。A object maintains a buffer to accommodate expansions to the string. 新数据追加到缓冲区，如果空间不可用;否则为分配新的、 更大的缓冲区、 原始缓冲区中的数据复制到新的缓冲区，并随后会将新数据追加到新的缓冲区。New data is appended to the buffer if room is available; otherwise, a new, larger buffer is allocated, data from the original buffer is copied to the new buffer, and the new data is then appended to the new buffer. > [!IMPORTANT] > 尽管类通常提供更好的性能比类，您应该不会自动替换与每当你想要操作的字符串。Although the class generally offers better performance than the class, you should not automatically replace with whenever you want to manipulate strings. 性能取决于字符串，并将其分配新字符串、 执行您的应用程序的系统和操作的类型的内存量的大小。Performance depends on the size of the string, the amount of memory to be allocated for the new string, the system on which your app is executing, and the type of operation. 您应该准备好测试应用程序以确定是否实际上提供了显著改善性能。You should be prepared to test your app to determine whether actually offers a significant performance improvement. 请考虑使用类在这些情况下：Consider using the class under these conditions: - 当您的应用程序将对字符串进行的更改数很小。When the number of changes that your app will make to a string is small. 在这些情况下，可能可以忽略不计的产品/服务或对任何性能改进。In these cases, might offer negligible or no performance improvement over . - 当正在执行固定的数量的串联操作中，尤其是对于字符串文本。When you are performing a fixed number of concatenation operations, particularly with string literals. 在这种情况下，编译器可能将合并到单个操作的串联操作。In this case, the compiler might combine the concatenation operations into a single operation. - 当必须执行广泛的搜索操作时要构建您的字符串。When you have to perform extensive search operations while you are building your string. 类缺少搜索方法，如`IndexOf`或`StartsWith`。The class lacks search methods such as `IndexOf` or `StartsWith`. 您必须将转换对象传递给为这些操作，这可以抵消性能受益于使用。You'll have to convert the object to a for these operations, and this can negate the performance benefit from using . 有关详细信息，请参阅[StringBuilder 对象中搜索的文本](#Searching)部分。For more information, see the [Searching the text in a StringBuilder object](#Searching) section. 请考虑使用类在这些情况下：Consider using the class under these conditions: - 如果期望您的应用程序在设计时 （例如，在使用一个循环来连接包含用户输入的字符串的随机数字时） 对字符串进行的更改数未知。When you expect your app to make an unknown number of changes to a string at design time (for example, when you are using a loop to concatenate a random number of strings that contain user input). - 当您希望对字符串进行大量更改您的应用程序。When you expect your app to make a significant number of changes to a string. ## StringBuilder 的工作原理How StringBuilder works 属性指示的字符数当前包含的对象。The property indicates the number of characters the object currently contains. 如果您添加到字符对象，直至等于的大小，其长度增加属性，定义的对象可包含的字符数。If you add characters to the object, its length increases until it equals the size of the property, which defines the number of characters that the object can contain. 如果添加了字符数导致的长度对象超过其当前容量、 新的内存分配，值加倍属性时，新的字符添加到对象，并且其调整属性。If the number of added characters causes the length of the object to exceed its current capacity, new memory is allocated, the value of the property is doubled, new characters are added to the object, and its property is adjusted. 额外的内存直到它达到定义的值动态分配对象属性。Additional memory for the object is allocated dynamically until it reaches the value defined by the property. 当达到最大容量时，可以为分配任何进一步的内存对象，并尝试添加字符或扩展到超过其最大容量引发任一或异常。When the maximum capacity is reached, no further memory can be allocated for the object, and trying to add characters or expand it beyond its maximum capacity throws either an or an exception. 下面的示例演示如何对象分配新内存，并动态地增加其容量，随着分配给该对象的字符串的扩展。The following example illustrates how a object allocates new memory and increases its capacity dynamically as the string assigned to the object expands. 该代码会创建对象通过调用其默认 （无参数） 构造函数。The code creates a object by calling its default (parameterless) constructor. 此对象的默认容量为 16 个字符，其最大容量为超过 20 亿个字符。The default capacity of this object is 16 characters, and its maximum capacity is more than 2 billion characters. 将字符串追加"这一个句子"。Appending the string "This is a sentence." 导致新的内存分配，因为字符串长度 （19 个字符） 超过默认容量对象。results in a new memory allocation because the string length (19 characters) exceeds the default capacity of the object. 对象的容量加倍为 32 个字符、 添加新字符串，并且对象的长度现在等于 19 个字符。The capacity of the object doubles to 32 characters, the new string is added, and the length of the object now equals 19 characters. 代码然后将字符串追加"这是其他句子"。The code then appends the string "This is an additional sentence." 值对象 11 次。to the value of the object 11 times. 每当追加操作导致的长度对象超出其容量，其现有的容量增加一倍和操作成功。Whenever the append operation causes the length of the object to exceed its capacity, its existing capacity is doubled and the operation succeeds. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/default1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/default1.vb#3)] ## 内存分配Memory allocation 默认容量对象是 16 个字符，其默认最大容量是。The default capacity of a object is 16 characters, and its default maximum capacity is . 如果调用使用这些默认值和构造函数。These default values are used if you call the and constructors. 您可以显式定义的初始容量对象中的以下方法：You can explicitly define the initial capacity of a object in the following ways: - 通过调用任一构造函数包含`capacity`参数创建对象时。By calling any of the constructors that includes a `capacity` parameter when you create the object. - 通过显式分配到一个新值要扩展的现有属性对象。By explicitly assigning a new value to the property to expand an existing object. 请注意，该属性将引发异常的新容量是否小于现有容量或大于对象的最大容量。Note that the property throws an exception if the new capacity is less than the existing capacity or greater than the object's maximum capacity. - 通过调用方法为新容量。By calling the method with the new capacity. 新的容量不能大于对象的最大容量。The new capacity must not be greater than the object's maximum capacity. 但是，与分配到不同属性，不会引发异常，如果所需的新容量小于现有容量; 在这种情况下，该方法调用不起作用。However, unlike an assignment to the property, does not throw an exception if the desired new capacity is less than the existing capacity; in this case, the method call has no effect. 如果字符串的长度分配给构造函数调用中的对象超过默认的容量或指定的容量属性设置为与指定的字符串的长度`value`参数。If the length of the string assigned to the object in the constructor call exceeds either the default capacity or the specified capacity, the property is set to the length of the string specified with the `value` parameter. 您可以显式定义的最大容量对象通过调用构造函数。You can explicitly define the maximum capacity of a object by calling the constructor. 不能通过将分配到一个新值更改的最大容量属性，因为它是只读的。You can't change the maximum capacity by assigning a new value to the property, because it is read-only. 如上一节所示，只要现有容量是不足、 其他内存分配的和容量对象定义的值为双精度型值属性。As the previous section shows, whenever the existing capacity is inadequate, additional memory is allocated and the capacity of a object doubles up to the value defined by the property. 一般情况下，默认的容量和最大容量就足够了对于大多数应用程序。In general, the default capacity and maximum capacity are adequate for most apps. 您可以考虑设置在以下情况下的这些值：You might consider setting these values under the following conditions: - 如果最终大小的对象很可能变得非常大，通常超过几兆字节。If the eventual size of the object is likely to grow exceedingly large, typically in excess of several megabytes. 在这种情况下，可能有一些性能受益于设置初始为非常高的值，以消除了过多内存重新分配需要的属性。In this case, there may be some performance benefit from setting the initial property to a significantly high value to eliminate the need for too many memory reallocations. - 如果您的应用程序具有有限的内存的系统上运行。If your app is running on a system with limited memory. 在这种情况下，可能想要设置，请考虑属性设置为小于如果您的应用程序处理可能导致其在内存受限的环境中执行的大型字符串。In this case, you may want to consider setting the property to less than if your app is handling large strings that may cause it to execute in a memory-constrained environment. ## 实例化 StringBuilder 对象Instantiating a StringBuilder object 实例化对象通过调用其六个的重载的类构造下, 表列出了这些函数之一。You instantiate a object by calling one of its six overloaded class constructors, which are listed in the following table. 三个构造函数实例化对象，其值为空字符串，但设置其和值以不同的方式。Three of the constructors instantiate a object whose value is an empty string, but set its and values differently. 剩余的三个构造函数定义具有特定的字符串值和容量的对象。The remaining three constructors define a object that has a specific string value and capacity. 两个三个构造函数使用的默认最大容量，而第三个可用于设置最大容量。Two of the three constructors use the default maximum capacity of , whereas the third allows you to set the maximum capacity. |构造函数Constructor|字符串值String value|容量Capacity|最大容量Maximum capacity| |-----------------|------------------|--------------|----------------------| |||1616|| |||通过定义`capacity`参数Defined by the `capacity` parameter|| |||通过定义`capacity`参数Defined by the `capacity` parameter|通过定义`maxCapacity`参数Defined by the `maxCapacity` parameter| ||通过定义`value`参数Defined by the `value` parameter|16 或`value`。16 or `value`. 更多, whichever is greater|| ||通过定义`value`参数Defined by the `value` parameter|定义由`capacity`参数或`value`。Defined by the `capacity` parameter or `value`. 两者中较大。, whichever is greater.|| ||由 `value` 定义。Defined by `value`. (`startIndex`, `length`)(`startIndex`, `length`)|定义由`capacity`参数或`value`。Defined by the `capacity` parameter or `value`. 两者中较大。, whichever is greater.|通过定义`maxCapacity`参数Defined by the `maxCapacity` parameter| 下面的示例使用三个构造函数重载来实例化对象。The following example uses three of these constructor overloads to instantiate objects. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#6)] ## 调用 StringBuilder 方法Calling StringBuilder methods 在修改字符串的方法的大多数实例返回到该同一实例的引用。Most of the methods that modify the string in a instance return a reference to that same instance. 这使您可以调用两种方法中的方法：This enables you to call methods in two ways: - 可以进行单个方法调用，并忽略返回值，如以下示例所示。You can make individual method calls and ignore the return value, as the following example does. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/call1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/call1.vb#4)] - 单个语句中，可以进行一系列方法调用。You can make a series of method calls in a single statement. 这会非常方便，如果你想要编写用于链接在连续的操作的单个语句。This can be convenient if you want to write a single statement that chains successive operations. 下面的示例将上一示例中的三个方法调用合并到一行代码。The following example consolidates three method calls from the previous example into a single line of code. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/call2.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/call2.vb#5)] ## 执行 StringBuilder 操作Performing StringBuilder operations 可以使用的方法类来循环访问、 添加、 删除或修改中的字符对象。You can use the methods of the class to iterate, add, delete, or modify characters in a object. ### 循环访问 StringBuilder 字符Iterating StringBuilder characters 您可以访问中的字符对象使用属性。You can access the characters in a object by using the property. 在 C# 中，是一个索引器; 在 Visual Basic 中，它是默认属性的类。In C#, is an indexer; in Visual Basic, it is the default property of the class. 这使您可以设置或检索个别字符使用它们的索引，而无需显式引用属性。This enables you to set or retrieve individual characters by using their index only, without explicitly referencing the property. 中的字符对象从索引 0 （零） 开始，继续索引-1。Characters in a object begin at index 0 (zero) and continue to index - 1. 下面的示例演示属性。The following example illustrates the property. 将追加到 10 个随机数字对象，然后循环访问每个字符。It appends ten random numbers to a object, and then iterates each character. 如果该字符的 Unicode 类别是，它按 1 递减数 （或如果其值为 0 的数字更改为 9）。If the character's Unicode category is , it decreases the number by 1 (or changes the number to 9 if its value is 0). 该示例显示的内容对象同时之前和之后的单个字符的值已更改。The example displays the contents of the object both before and after the values of individual characters were changed. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/chars1.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/chars1.vb#7)] [!INCLUDE[stringbuilder-performance-note](~/includes/stringbuilder-perf-note.md)] ### 将文本添加到 StringBuilder 对象Adding text to a StringBuilder object 类包括以下方法来扩展的内容对象：The class includes the following methods for expanding the contents of a object: - 方法将追加字符串、 一个子字符串、 字符数组、 字符数组的一部分的单个字符重复多次，或的字符串表示形式的基元数据类型更改为对象。The method appends a string, a substring, a character array, a portion of a character array, a single character repeated multiple times, or the string representation of a primitive data type to a object. - 方法将行终止符或行终止符字符串追加对象。The method appends a line terminator or a string along with a line terminator to a object. - 方法将追加[复合格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md)到对象。The method appends a [composite format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md) to a object. 字符串表示形式的结果字符串中包含的对象可以反映当前系统区域性或指定的区域性的格式设置约定。The string representations of objects included in the result string can reflect the formatting conventions of the current system culture or a specified culture. - 方法插入一个字符串，子字符串，字符串的多个重复的字符数组、 字符数组的部分或基元数据的字符串表示形式中指定位置处键入对象。The method inserts a string, a substring, multiple repetitions of a string, a character array, a portion of a character array, or the string representation of a primitive data type at a specified position in the object. 按从零开始的索引定义位置。The position is defined by a zero-based index. 下面的示例使用， ， ，和方法以展开的文本对象。The following example uses the , , , and methods to expand the text of a object. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/expand1.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/expand1.vb#9)] ### 从 StringBuilder 对象中删除文本Deleting text from a StringBuilder object 类包括可以减少的当前大小的方法实例。The class includes methods that can reduce the size of the current instance. 方法中删除所有字符，并设置属性设置为零。The method removes all characters and sets the property to zero. 方法中删除指定的数量的特定索引位置开始的字符。The method deletes a specified number of characters starting at a particular index position. 此外，从末尾删除字符对象通过设置其属性的值小于当前实例的长度。In addition, you can remove characters from the end of a object by setting its property to a value that is less than the length of the current instance. 以下示例将删除的某些从文本对象，显示其生成的容量、 最大容量和长度属性值，然后调用方法来删除中的所有字符对象。The following example removes some of the text from a object, displays its resulting capacity, maximum capacity, and length property values, and then calls the method to remove all the characters from the object. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/delete1.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/delete1.vb#10)] ### 修改 StringBuilder 对象中的文本Modifying the text in a StringBuilder object 方法替换所有出现的字符或字符串中整个对象或在特定的字符范围内。The method replaces all occurrences of a character or a string in the entire object or in a particular character range. 下面的示例使用方法中使用问号 （？） 替换所有感叹号 （！）对象。The following example uses the method to replace all exclamation points (!) with question marks (?) in the object. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/replace1.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/replace1.vb#11)] ## StringBuilder 对象中搜索的文本Searching the text in a StringBuilder object 类不包括方法类似于， ，和提供的方法类，该类，您可以搜索特定字符或子字符串的对象。The class does not include methods similar to the , , and methods provided by the class, which allow you to search the object for a particular character or a substring. 确定是否存在或启动的子字符串的字符位置需要您搜索使用字符串搜索方法或正则表达式方法的值。Determining the presence or starting character position of a substring requires that you search a value by using either a string search method or a regular expression method. 有四种方法来实现此类搜索，如下表所示。There are four ways to implement such searches, as the following table shows. |技术Technique|专业人员Pros|缺点Cons| |---------------|----------|----------| |将它们添加到之前搜索的字符串值对象。Search string values before adding them to the object.|可用于确定是否存在某个子字符串。Useful for determining whether a substring exists.|不能使用子字符串的索引位置很重要。Cannot be used when the index position of a substring is important.| |调用并搜索返回对象。Call and search the returned object.|易于使用如果分配到的所有文本对象，并开始对其进行修改。Easy to use if you assign all the text to a object, and then begin to modify it.|重复调用不便于如果您必须进行修改的所有文本都添加到之前对象。Cumbersome to repeatedly call if you must make modifications before all text is added to the object.

您必须记得从末尾对象的文本，如果您要做的更改。You must remember to work from the end of the object's text if you're making changes.| |使用属性按顺序搜索的字符范围。Use the property to sequentially search a range of characters.|如果您关心的单个字符或小的子字符串，这很有用。Useful if you're concerned with individual characters or a small substring.|如果要搜索的字符数较大，或者搜索逻辑很复杂繁琐。Cumbersome if the number of characters to search is large or if the search logic is complex.

已变得非常大而通过重复进行方法调用的对象的性能非常不佳的结果。Results in very poor performance for objects that have grown very large through repeated method calls. | |将转换对象传递给对象，并在执行修改对象。Convert the object to a object, and perform modifications on the object.|如果修改的数量较少时很有用。Useful if the number of modifications is small.|求反的性能优势类如果的修改量很大。Negates the performance benefit of the class if the number of modifications is large.| 让我们看一下中更详细地介绍这些技术。Let's examine these techniques in greater detail. - 如果搜索的目标是确定是否存在某个特定的子字符串的 （即，如果您不感兴趣子字符串的位置），可以搜索字符串之前将它们存储在对象。If the goal of the search is to determine whether a particular substring exists (that is, if you aren't interested in the position of the substring), you can search strings before storing them in the object. 下面的示例提供了一种可能实现。The following example provides one possible implementation. 它定义`StringBuilderFinder`类的构造函数传递的引用对象和要在字符串中找到的子字符串。It defines a `StringBuilderFinder` class whose constructor is passed a reference to a object and the substring to find in the string. 在这种情况下，此示例尝试确定是否记录的温度华氏或摄氏温度，并将相应的介绍性文本添加到的开头对象。In this case, the example tries to determine whether recorded temperatures are in Fahrenheit or Celsius, and adds the appropriate introductory text to the beginning of the object. 随机数生成器用于选择包含摄氏度或华氏度中的数据的数组。A random number generator is used to select an array that contains data in either degrees Celsius or degrees Fahrenheit. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/pattern1.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/pattern1.vb#12)] - 调用方法将转换对象传递给对象。Call the method to convert the object to a object. 可以使用类似于方法搜索字符串或，也可以使用正则表达式和类来搜索的模式。You can search the string by using methods such as or , or you can use regular expressions and the class to search for patterns. 因为这两和对象使用 utf-16 编码用于存储字符，子字符串的索引位置的字符和正则表达式匹配项是在这两个对象相同。Because both and objects use UTF-16 encoding to store characters, the index positions of characters, substrings, and regular expression matches are the same in both objects. 这使您可以使用方法，以便可以在同一位置中找到该文本的更改对象。This enables you to use methods to make changes at the same position at which that text is found in the object. > [!NOTE] > 如果采用这种方法，你应从结尾处起作用对象到其开始，因此无需重复转换为字符串的对象。If you adopt this approach, you should work from the end of the object to its beginning so that you don't have to repeatedly convert the object to a string. 下面的示例阐释了这种方法。The following example illustrates this approach. 它将存储在英语字母表中的每个字母的四个匹配项对象。It stores four occurrences of each letter of the English alphabet in a object. 然后将转换为文本对象，并使用正则表达式来标识每个四个字符序列的起始位置。It then converts the text to a object and uses a regular expression to identify the starting position of each four-character sequence. 最后，它将添加下划线前除第一个序列，每个四个字符序列，并将转换为大写的序列的第一个字符。Finally, it adds an underscore before each four-character sequence except for the first sequence, and converts the first character of the sequence to uppercase. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/pattern2.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/pattern2.vb#13)] - 使用属性按顺序搜索中的字符范围对象。Use the property to sequentially search a range of characters in a object. 如果要在其中搜索的字符数很大或搜索逻辑是特别复杂，这种方法可能不可行。This approach may not be practical if the number of characters to be searched is large or the search logic is particularly complex. 逐字符基于索引的访问对性能产生影响非常大，chunked对象，请参阅的文档属性。For the performance implications of character-by-character index-based access for very large, chunked objects, see the documentation for the property. 下面的示例在功能上与前面的示例相同，但在实现中不同。The following example is identical in functionality to the previous example but differs in implementation. 它使用属性来检测何时更改字符值，将在该位置处插入下划线，并将新序列中的第一个字符转换为大写。It uses the property to detect when a character value has changed, inserts an underscore at that position, and converts the first character in the new sequence to uppercase. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/pattern3.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/pattern3.vb#14)] - 存储中的所有未修改的文本对象，请调用方法将转换对象传递给对象，并执行上所做的修改对象。Store all the unmodified text in the object, call the method to convert the object to a object, and perform the modifications on the object. 如果您有仅几个修改; 可以使用此方法否则，使用不可变的字符串的成本可能会抵消使用的性能好处对象。You can use this approach if you have only a few modifications; otherwise, the cost of working with immutable strings may negate the performance benefits of using a object. 下面的示例是在功能上与前两个示例相同，但在实现中不同。The following example is identical in functionality to the previous two examples but differs in implementation. 它会创建对象，将其转换为对象，然后再使用正则表达式对字符串执行剩余的所有修改。It creates a object, converts it to a object, and then uses a regular expression to perform all remaining modifications on the string. 方法使用 lambda 表达式，对每个匹配项执行替换。The method uses a lambda expression to perform the replacement on each match. [!code-csharp[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/cs/pattern4.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Text.StringBuilder.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.text.stringbuilder.class/vb/pattern4.vb#15)] ## 将 StringBuilder 对象转换为字符串Converting the StringBuilder object to a string 必须先将 对象转换为 对象，然后才能将 对象表示的字符串传递给包含 参数的方法，或在用户界面中显示它。You must convert the object to a object before you can pass the string represented by the object to a method that has a parameter or display it in the user interface. 通过调用来执行此转换方法。You perform this conversion by calling the method. 有关说明，请参阅上述示例中，后者调用方法将对象为字符串，以便它可以传递到正则表达式方法。For an illustration, see the previous example, which calls the method to convert a object to a string so that it can be passed to a regular expression method. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何调用定义的方法的许多类。The following example shows how to call many of the methods defined by the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法使用[复合格式设置功能](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md)的.NET Framework，才能将对象的值转换为其文本表示形式并将该表示形式嵌入在当前对象。This method uses the [composite formatting feature](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md) of the .NET Framework to convert the value of an object to its text representation and embed that representation in the current object. `format`参数由零个或多个文本和零个或多个索引占位符称为格式项混和组成。The `format` parameter consists of zero or more runs of text intermixed with zero or more indexed placeholders, called format items. 格式项的索引必须为 0，对应于`arg0`，此方法的参数列表中的单个对象。The index of the format items must be 0, to correspond to `arg0`, the single object in the parameter list of this method. 格式设置过程将每个格式项替换的字符串表示形式`arg0`。The formatting process replaces each format item with the string representation of `arg0`. 格式项的语法如下所示：The syntax of a format item is as follows: {*index*[,*length*][:*formatString*]}{*index*[,*length*][:*formatString*]} 括号中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*index**index*|参数列表中要进行格式化的对象的从零开始位置。The zero-based position in the parameter list of the object to be formatted. 如果指定的对象*索引*是`null`，格式项都替换为。If the object specified by *index* is `null`, the format item is replaced by . 如果在没有参数*索引*位置，引发。If there is no parameter in the *index* position, a is thrown.| |,*length*,*length*|最小参数的字符串表示形式中的字符数。The minimum number of characters in the string representation of the parameter. 如果为正数，该参数为右对齐;如果为负数，它是左对齐。If positive, the parameter is right-aligned; if negative, it is left-aligned.| |:*formatString*:*formatString*|由参数支持标准或自定义格式字符串。A standard or custom format string that is supported by the parameter.| > [!NOTE] > 有关使用日期和时间值的标准和自定义格式字符串，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)并[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For the standard and custom format strings used with date and time values, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 对于标准和自定义格式字符串与数值一起使用，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)并[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For the standard and custom format strings used with numeric values, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 用于枚举的标准格式字符串，请参阅[枚举格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md)。For the standard format strings used with enumerations, see [Enumeration Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md). `arg0` 表示要设置格式的对象。`arg0` represents the object to be formatted. 在每个格式项`format`替换的字符串表示形式`arg0`。Each format item in `format` is replaced with the string representation of `arg0`. 如果格式项包括`formatString`并`arg0`实现接口，则`arg0.ToString(formatString, null)`定义格式设置。If the format item includes `formatString` and `arg0` implements the interface, then `arg0.ToString(formatString, null)` defines the formatting. 否则为`arg0.ToString()`定义格式设置。Otherwise, `arg0.ToString()` defines the formatting. 如果字符串分配给`format`是"谢谢您捐赠 {0: # # #} 罐食品给我们的慈善组织。"If the string assigned to `format` is "Thank you for your donation of {0:####} cans of food to our charitable organization." 和`arg0`是一个整数值为 10，返回值将是"谢谢您捐赠 10 罐食品给我们的慈善组织。"and `arg0` is an integer with the value 10, the return value will be "Thank you for your donation of 10 cans of food to our charitable organization." ## 如果格式项包括`formatString`并`arg0`实现接口，则`arg0.ToString(formatString, provider)`定义格式设置。If the format item includes `formatString` and `arg0` implements the interface, then `arg0.ToString(formatString, provider)` defines the formatting. 否则为`arg0.ToString()`定义格式设置。Otherwise, `arg0.ToString()` defines the formatting. ## Examples 下面包含两个调用方法。The following includes two calls to the method. 同时使用英语 Great Britain (en-GB) 区域性的格式设置约定。Both use the formatting conventions of the English-Great Britain (en-GB) culture. 第一个插入的字符串表示形式值在结果字符串中的货币。The first inserts the string representation of a value currency in a result string. 第二个插入字符串值在结果中的两个位置，第一个包括，仅短日期字符串和第二个短时间字符串。The second inserts a value in two places in a result string, the first including only the short date string and the second the short time remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法使用[复合格式设置功能](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md)的.NET Framework，才能将对象的值转换为其文本表示形式并将该表示形式嵌入在当前对象。This method uses the [composite formatting feature](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md) of the .NET Framework to convert the value of an object to its text representation and embed that representation in the current object. `format`参数由零个或多个文本与零个或多个索引占位符称为格式项，此方法的参数列表中的对象相对应的混合。The `format` parameter consists of zero or more runs of text intermixed with zero or more indexed placeholders, called format items, that correspond to objects in the parameter list of this method. 格式设置过程将每个格式项替换相应的对象的字符串表示形式。The formatting process replaces each format item with the string representation of the corresponding object. 格式项的语法如下所示：The syntax of a format item is as follows: {*index*[,*length*][:*formatString*]}{*index*[,*length*][:*formatString*]} 括号中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*index**index*|参数列表中要进行格式化的对象的从零开始位置。The zero-based position in the parameter list of the object to be formatted. 如果指定的对象*索引*是`null`，格式项都替换为。If the object specified by *index* is `null`, the format item is replaced by . 如果在没有参数*索引*位置，引发。If there is no parameter in the *index* position, a is thrown.| |,*length*,*length*|最小参数的字符串表示形式中的字符数。The minimum number of characters in the string representation of the parameter. 如果为正数，该参数为右对齐;如果为负数，它是左对齐。If positive, the parameter is right-aligned; if negative, it is left-aligned.| |:*formatString*:*formatString*|由参数支持标准或自定义格式字符串。A standard or custom format string that is supported by the parameter.| > [!NOTE] > 有关使用日期和时间值的标准和自定义格式字符串，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)并[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For the standard and custom format strings used with date and time values, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 对于标准和自定义格式字符串与数值一起使用，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)并[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For the standard and custom format strings used with numeric values, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 用于枚举的标准格式字符串，请参阅[枚举格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md)。For the standard format strings used with enumerations, see [Enumeration Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md). `provider`参数指定可以提供格式设置信息中的对象的实现`args`。The `provider` parameter specifies an implementation that can provide formatting information for the objects in `args`. `provider` 可以是以下任意形式：`provider` can be any of the following: - 一个提供特定于区域性的格式设置信息的对象。A object that provides culture-specific formatting information. - 一个对象，它提供区域性特定格式设置信息中的数字值`args`。A object that provides culture-specific formatting information for numeric values in `args`. - 一个对象，它提供区域性特定格式设置信息中的日期和时间值`args`。A object that provides culture-specific formatting information for date and time values in `args`. - 自定义实现，提供一个或多个中的对象的格式设置信息`args`。A custom implementation that provides formatting information for one or more of the objects in `args`. 通常情况下，此类实现还实现接口。Typically, such an implementation also implements the interface. 下一节中的第二个示例说明了使用自定义方法调用实现。The second example in the next section illustrates an method call with a custom implementation. 如果`provider`参数是`null`，从当前区域获得格式提供程序信息。If the `provider` parameter is `null`, format provider information is obtained from the current culture. `args` 表示要设置格式的对象。`args` represents the objects to be formatted. 在每个格式项`format`中的相应对象的字符串表示形式替换`args`。Each format item in `format` is replaced with the string representation of the corresponding object in `args`. 如果格式项包括`formatString`和中的相应对象`args`实现接口，则`args[index].ToString(formatString, provider)`定义格式设置。If the format item includes `formatString` and the corresponding object in `args` implements the interface, then `args[index].ToString(formatString, provider)` defines the formatting. 否则为`args[index].ToString()`定义格式设置。Otherwise, `args[index].ToString()` defines the formatting. ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法使用[复合格式设置功能](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md)的.NET Framework，才能将对象的值转换为其文本表示形式并将该表示形式嵌入在当前对象。This method uses the [composite formatting feature](~/docs/standard/base-types/composite-formatting.md) of the .NET Framework to convert the value of an object to its text representation and embed that representation in the current object. `format`参数由零个或多个文本与零个或多个索引占位符称为格式项，此方法的参数列表中的对象相对应的混合。The `format` parameter consists of zero or more runs of text intermixed with zero or more indexed placeholders, called format items, that correspond to objects in the parameter list of this method. 格式设置过程将每个格式项替换相应的对象的字符串表示形式。The formatting process replaces each format item with the string representation of the corresponding object. 格式项的语法如下所示：The syntax of a format item is as follows: {*index*[,*length*][:*formatString*]}{*index*[,*length*][:*formatString*]} 括号中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*index**index*|参数列表中要进行格式化的对象的从零开始位置。The zero-based position in the parameter list of the object to be formatted. 如果指定的对象*索引*是`null`，格式项都替换为。If the object specified by *index* is `null`, the format item is replaced by . 如果在没有参数*索引*位置，引发。If there is no parameter in the *index* position, a is thrown.| |,*length*,*length*|最小参数的字符串表示形式中的字符数。The minimum number of characters in the string representation of the parameter. 如果为正数，该参数为右对齐;如果为负数，它是左对齐。If positive, the parameter is right-aligned; if negative, it is left-aligned.| |:*formatString*:*formatString*|由参数支持标准或自定义格式字符串。A standard or custom format string that is supported by the parameter.| > [!NOTE] > 有关使用日期和时间值的标准和自定义格式字符串，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)并[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For the standard and custom format strings used with date and time values, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 对于标准和自定义格式字符串与数值一起使用，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)并[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For the standard and custom format strings used with numeric values, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 用于枚举的标准格式字符串，请参阅[枚举格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md)。For the standard format strings used with enumerations, see [Enumeration Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/enumeration-format-strings.md). `provider`参数指定实现，它可以提供格式设置信息`arg0`和`arg1`。The `provider` parameter specifies an implementation that can provide formatting information for `arg0` and `arg1`. `provider` 可以是以下任意形式：`provider` can be any of the following: - 一个提供特定于区域性的格式设置信息的对象。A object that provides culture-specific formatting information. - 一个对象，它提供区域性特定格式设置信息`arg0`或`arg1`如果它们是数字值。A object that provides culture-specific formatting information for `arg0` or `arg1` if they are numeric values. - 一个对象，它提供区域性特定格式设置信息`arg0`或`arg1`如果它们是日期和时间值。A object that provides culture-specific formatting information for `arg0` or `arg1` if they are date and time values. - 自定义实现，提供的格式设置信息`arg0`和`arg1`。A custom implementation that provides formatting information for `arg0` and `arg1`. 通常情况下，此类实现还实现接口。Typically, such an implementation also implements the interface. 如果`provider`参数是`null`，从当前区域获得格式提供程序信息。If the `provider` parameter is `null`, format provider information is obtained from the current culture. `arg0` 和`arg1`表示要设置格式的对象。`arg0` and `arg1` represent the objects to be formatted. 在每个格式项`format`将替换为具有相应的索引的对象的字符串表示形式。Each format item in `format` is replaced with the string representation of the object that has the corresponding index. 如果格式项包括`formatString`并实现相应的参数接口，则参数的`ToString(formatString, provider)`方法定义的格式设置。If the format item includes `formatString` and the corresponding argument implements the interface, then the argument's `ToString(formatString, provider)` method defines the formatting. 否则为参数的`ToString()`方法定义的格式设置。Otherwise, the argument's `ToString()` method defines the formatting. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法来显示时间和温度数据存储在一个泛型对象。The following example uses the method to display time and temperature data stored in a generic object. 请注意格式字符串具有三个格式项，尽管仅向要格式化的对象。Note that the format string has three format items, although there are only to objects to format. 这是因为在使用两个格式项列表 （日期和时间值） 中的第一个对象：第一个格式项的显示时，第二个显示的日期。This is because the first object in the list (a date and time value) is used by two format items: The first format item displays the time, and the second displays the date. represent the objects to be formatted. 在每个格式项`format`将替换为具有相应的索引的对象的字符串表示形式。Each format item in `format` is replaced with the string representation of the object that has the corresponding index. 如果格式项包括`formatString`并实现相应的参数接口，则参数的`ToString(formatString, provider)`方法定义的格式设置。If the format item includes `formatString` and the corresponding argument implements the interface, then the argument's `ToString(formatString, provider)` method defines the formatting. 否则为参数的`ToString()`方法定义的格式设置。Otherwise, the argument's `ToString()` method defines the formatting. ## Examples remarks.format: ## Remarks 长度对象由其数量定义对象。The length of a object is defined by its number of objects. 像属性，属性指示当前字符串对象的长度。Like the property, the property indicates the length of the current string object. 与不同属性，它是只读的属性允许您修改存储到字符串的长度对象。Unlike the property, which is read-only, the property allows you to modify the length of the string stored to the object. 如果指定的长度小于当前长度，当前对象将被截断为指定的长度。If the specified length is less than the current length, the current object is truncated to the specified length. 如果指定的长度大于当前长度的字符串值的当前末尾对象则用 Unicode NULL 字符填充 (U + 0000)。If the specified length is greater than the current length, the end of the string value of the current object is padded with the Unicode NULL character (U+0000). 如果指定的长度大于当前容量会增加，这样就大于或等于指定长度。If the specified length is greater than the current capacity, increases so that it is greater than or equal to the specified length. ## Examples 下面的示例演示属性。The following example demonstrates the property. [!code-cpp[stringbuilder.ensurecapacity#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/stringbuilder.ensurecapacity/CPP/cap.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[stringbuilder.ensurecapacity#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/stringbuilder.ensurecapacity/CS/cap.cs#1)] [!code-vb[stringbuilder.ensurecapacity#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/stringbuilder.ensurecapacity/VB/cap.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此实现的最大容量。The maximum capacity for this implementation is . 但是，此值是特定于实现的可能会在其他或更高版本的实现有所不同。However, this value is implementation-specific and might be different in other or later implementations. 您可以显式设置的最大容量对象通过调用构造函数。You can explicitly set the maximum capacity of a object by calling the constructor. 在.NET Core 和.NET Framework 4.0 和更高版本中，当您实例化对象通过调用构造函数的长度和的容量实例可以增长到的值超过其属性。In .NET Core and in the .NET Framework 4.0 and later versions, when you instantiate the object by calling the constructor, both the length and the capacity of the instance can grow beyond the value of its property. 发生这种情况尤其是当您调用和追加小型字符串的方法。This can occur particularly when you call the and methods to append small strings.
